intro: Acridocarpus goossensii, commonly known as the Goossens' acridocarpus, is a species of flowering plant in the family Anacardiaceae. It is native to Madagascar and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces woody fruits that contain several seeds, typical of many species in its family. It thrives in tropical climates and is often found in moist, shaded environments. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
